snippet: As more tech firms employ their own editing staffs, they are being viewed as something less than news organizations, but more than simple reflections of their growing audiences.
abstract: Facebook, Twitter and other social media companies are increasing their roles as news and entertainment curators, filling in gaps left by conventional news organizations and hiring editorial specialists to determine platform content; widening influence leads to questions regarding how content is chosen, with some speculating that companies could face new level of scrutiny.
lead_paragraph: As more tech firms employ their own editing staffs, they are being viewed as something less than news organizations, but more than simple reflections of their growing audiences.

headline.main: Social Media Finds New Role as News and Entertainment Curator
headline.print_headline: Social Media Takes On New Role as News and Entertainment Curator
